ascidia.name: Ascidia
ascidia.description: Ascidia is a simple marine tunicate. Adult is sessile, larva is free-swimming. Shows chordate features in larval stage.
introduction: Ascidia lives attached to rocks in shallow seas.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan, Deuterostomous
Nervous system: Dorsal nerve cord in larva, reduced in adult
sizeStructure: Covered by tunic made of tunicin

herdmania.name: Herdmania
herdmania.description: Herdmania is a solitary ascidian. Body is tough and brightly coloured. Adult lacks notochord.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pharyngeal respiration through gill slits
Nervous system: Reduced nerve ganglion in adult

salpa.name: Salpa
salpa.description: Salpa is a free-swimming pelagic urochordate. Body is transparent and barrel-shaped. Shows alternation of generations.
introduction: Salpa lives in open marine waters.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pharyngeal respiration through gill slits

doliolum.name: Doliolum
doliolum.description: Doliolum is a small pelagic tunicate. Shows complex polymorphism. Common in plankton.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pharyngeal respiration through gill slits

pyrosoma.name: Pyrosoma
pyrosoma.description: Pyrosoma is a colonial pelagic tunicate. Colony is tubular and luminous. Shows bioluminescence.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pharyngeal respiration through gill slits

branchiostoma.name: Branchiostoma
branchiostoma.description: Branchiostoma lanceolatum is a primitive chordate. It retains chordate characters throughout life. Widely used to study chordate evolution.
introduction: Branchiostoma lanceolatum lives buried in sandy marine bottoms.
Acts as a connecting link between invertebrates and vertebrates.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pharyngeal respiration through gill slits
Skeleton structure: Endoskeleton absent (notochord present throughout life)
Nervous system: Dorsal hollow nerve cord without brain
ecology: Part of marine benthic food web

petromyzon.name: Petromyzon
petromyzon.description: Petromyzon marinus is a jawless vertebrate. It is ectoparasitic in adult stage. Belongs to primitive cyclostomes.
introduction: Petromyzon marinus lives in marine and freshwater.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Branchial respiration through gill pouches
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

myxine.name: Myxine
myxine.description: Myxine glutinosa is a jawless marine vertebrate. Produces copious slime. Scavenger in deep seas.
introduction: Myxine glutinosa lives in marine environments.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Branchial respiration through gill pouches
Nervous system: Brain present, reduced sense organs

scoliodon.name: Scoliodon
scoliodon.description: Scoliodon laticaudus is a small marine shark. Body is spindle-shaped. Commonly used as a cartilaginous fish example.
introduction: Scoliodon lives in coastal marine waters.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Branchial respiration through gills
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

carcharodon.name: Carcharodon
carcharodon.description: Carcharodon carcharias includes the largest predatory sharks. Body is powerful and fast-swimming. Top marine carnivore.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

pristis.name: Pristis
pristis.description: Pristis is a shark-like ray. Snout is elongated into a saw. Lives in coastal waters.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

trygon.name: Trygon
trygon.description: Trygon is a bottom-dwelling ray. Tail bears venomous spine. Body is dorsoventrally flattened.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

torpedo.name: Torpedo
torpedo.description: Torpedo produces electric shocks. Body is flattened and soft. Specialized marine fish.
introduction: Torpedo lives on sandy sea bottoms.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

exocoetus.name: Exocoetus
exocoetus.description: Exocoetus is a marine bony fish. It glides above water using enlarged fins. Not capable of true flight.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

hippocampus.name: Hippocampus
hippocampus.description: Hippocampus has an upright posture. Male carries eggs in brood pouch. Unique among fishes.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

labeo.name: Labeo
labeo.description: Labeo rohita is a major Indian carp. Freshwater edible fish. Widely cultured.
introduction: Labeo rohita lives in rivers and ponds.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

catla.name: Catla
catla.description: Catla catla is a surface-feeding carp. Large head and mouth. Fast growing fish.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

clarias.name: Clarias
clarias.description: Clarias batrachus is an air-breathing fish. Can survive out of water. Moves short distances on land.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Branchial and accessory respiration

echeneis.name: Echeneis
echeneis.description: Echeneis attaches to large animals. Has adhesive disc on head. Commensal fish.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

betta.name: Betta
betta.description: Betta splendens is a territorial fish. Males fight aggressively. Labyrinth organ present.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Branchial and aerial respiration

pterophyllum.name: Pterophyllum
pterophyllum.description: Pterophyllum scalare is a graceful aquarium fish. Body is laterally compressed. Freshwater cichlid.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

latimeria.name: Latimeria
latimeria.description: Latimeria chalumnae is a living fossil. Lobe-finned fish. Once thought extinct.
introduction: Latimeria chalumnae lives in deep sea.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

protopterus.name: Protopterus
protopterus.description: Protopterus annectens is a lungfish. It can breathe air using lungs. Acts as a connecting link between fishes and amphibians.
introduction: Protopterus annectens lives in freshwater swamps and rivers.
It survives dry seasons by aestivation.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Branchial and pulmonary respiration
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

bufo.name: Bufo
bufo.description: Bufo is a terrestrial amphibian. Skin is dry and warty. Poison glands present.
introduction: Bufo lives on land near water bodies.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pulmonary, cutaneous and buccopharyngeal
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

alytes.name: Alytes
alytes.description: Alytes shows male parental care. Eggs are carried by male. Small terrestrial toad.
introduction: Alytes lives in moist terrestrial habitats.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

hyla.name: Hyla
hyla.description: Hyla is an arboreal frog. Toe pads present. Good climber.
introduction: Hyla lives on trees near water.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

rhacophorus.name: Rhacophorus
rhacophorus.description: Rhacophorus glides using webbed feet. Arboreal frog. Known for foam nests.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

rana.name: Rana
rana.description: Rana is a semi-aquatic frog. Smooth moist skin present. Good jumper.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Pulmonary, cutaneous and buccopharyngeal
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

necturus.name: Necturus
necturus.description: Necturus maculosus retains larval characters. External gills present in adult. Aquatic salamander.
introduction: Necturus lives in freshwater lakes and streams.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: External gills and skin
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

ambystoma.name: Ambystoma
ambystoma.description: Ambystoma tigrinum is a large salamander. Shows metamorphosis. Terrestrial adult.
introduction: Ambystoma lives in moist land habitats.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

salamandra.name: Salamandra
salamandra.description: Salamandra has warning coloration. Skin glands secrete toxins. Terrestrial salamander.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

ichthyophis.name: Ichthyophis
ichthyophis.description: Ichthyophis is a limbless amphibian. Body resembles earthworm. Burrowing habit.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

hemidactylus.name: Hemidactylus
hemidactylus.description: Hemidactylus is a small arboreal lizard. It is nocturnal and insectivorous. Commonly found in human dwellings.
introduction: Hemidactylus lives in warm terrestrial habitats.
It is agile and climbs vertical surfaces.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

calotes.name: Calotes
calotes.description: Calotes is a diurnal arboreal lizard. Males show colour change during breeding. Common in gardens and forests.
introduction: It is insectivorous and active by day.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

draco.name: Draco
draco.description: Draco is a gliding arboreal lizard. Has wing-like patagia. Not capable of true flight.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

chamaeleon.name: Chamaeleon
chamaeleon.description: Chamaeleon is a colour-changing lizard. Eyes move independently. Specialized for arboreal life.
introduction: Chamaeleon lives in trees and shrubs.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

phrynosoma.name: Phrynosoma
phrynosoma.description: Phrynosoma is a desert lizard. Body is flattened with horns. Feeds mainly on ants.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

varanus.name: Varanus
varanus.description: Varanus is a large predatory lizard. Highly intelligent reptile. Found in terrestrial and aquatic habitats.
introduction: Varanus inhabits forests, deserts, and wetlands.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

sphenodon_punctatum.name: Sphenodon punctatum
sphenodon_punctatum.description: Sphenodon punctatum is a living fossil. Only surviving member of Rhynchocephalia. Endemic to New Zealand.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double

chelone.name: Chelone
chelone.description: Chelone is a large marine reptile. Body is adapted for swimming. Shell is hard and protective.
introduction: It is aquatic and herbivorous or omnivorous.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Skeleton structure: Endoskeleton with exoskeletal shell
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

testudo.name: Testudo
testudo.description: Testudo is a terrestrial reptile. It has a heavy domed shell. Slow-moving herbivore.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Circulatory type: Closed circulation, incomplete double
Skeleton structure: Endoskeleton with exoskeletal shell

naja_naja.name: Naja naja
naja_naja.description: Naja naja is a venomous snake. Has expandable hood. Highly poisonous.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

vipera_russelli.name: Vipera russelli
vipera_russelli.description: Vipera russelli is a highly venomous snake. Aggressive in nature. Causes severe snakebite cases.
introduction: Vipera russelli lives in dry land and fields.
One of the most dangerous snakes.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

bungarus.name: Bungarus
bungarus.description: Bungarus is a venomous snake genus. Mostly nocturnal. Highly poisonous neurotoxic venom.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

hydrophis.name: Hydrophis
hydrophis.description: Hydrophis is a marine snake genus. Highly venomous. Adapted for aquatic life.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

typhlops.name: Typhlops
typhlops.description: Typhlops is a small burrowing snake. Eyes are reduced. Non-venomous.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

python.name: Python
python.description: Python is a large non-venomous snake. Kills prey by constriction. One of the longest snakes.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

crocodylus.name: Crocodylus
crocodylus.description: Crocodylus is a large semi-aquatic reptile. It is carnivorous and aggressive. Found in tropical rivers and estuaries.
introduction: Crocodylus inhabits freshwater and brackish water.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

gavialis_gangeticus.name: Gavialis gangeticus
gavialis_gangeticus.description: Gavialis gangeticus is a fish-eating crocodilian. It has a long narrow snout. Endemic to Indian rivers.
introduction: Gavialis gangeticus lives in freshwater rivers.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

alligator.name: Alligator
alligator.description: Alligator is a large freshwater reptile. Less aggressive than crocodiles. Found mainly in North America.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

ichthyosaurus_communis.name: Ichthyosaurus communis
ichthyosaurus_communis.description: Ichthyosaurus communis was a marine reptile. Body resembled modern dolphins. Lived during Mesozoic era.
introduction: It was fully aquatic and carnivorous.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

triceratops_horridus.name: Triceratops horridus
triceratops_horridus.description: Triceratops horridus was a herbivorous dinosaur. Had three facial horns. Lived in late Cretaceous.
introduction: One of the largest horned dinosaurs.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

stegosaurus_stenops.name: Stegosaurus stenops
stegosaurus_stenops.description: Stegosaurus stenops was a herbivorous dinosaur. Had bony plates on back. Lived in Jurassic period.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

brachiosaurus_altithorax.name: Brachiosaurus altithorax
brachiosaurus_altithorax.description: Brachiosaurus altithorax was a gigantic dinosaur. Had long neck and forelimbs. Herbivorous sauropod.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

tyrannosaurus_rex.name: Tyrannosaurus rex
tyrannosaurus_rex.description: Tyrannosaurus rex was a top carnivore. Powerful jaws and teeth. One of the most famous dinosaurs.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

pteranodon_longiceps.name: Pteranodon longiceps
pteranodon_longiceps.description: Pteranodon longiceps was a flying reptile. Had large wing span. Fed mainly on fish.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

corvus.name: Corvus
corvus.description: Corvus is a highly intelligent bird. It adapts easily to human environments. Omnivorous and alert.
introduction: Found in cities, villages, and forests.
Feeds on insects, grains, and waste.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

columba.name: Columba
columba.description: Columba is a seed-eating bird. Strong flyer with good navigation. Common near humans.
introduction: Lives in cities and rocky regions.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

psittacula.name: Psittacula
psittacula.description: Psittacula is a colourful bird. Curved beak and long tail. Highly vocal.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

pavo_cristatus.name: Pavo cristatus
pavo_cristatus.description: Large ornamental bird. Male has colourful train. National bird of India.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

aptenodytes_forsteri.name: Aptenodytes forsteri
aptenodytes_forsteri.description: Largest penguin species. Flightless marine bird. Excellent swimmer.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

struthio_camelus.name: Struthio camelus
struthio_camelus.description: Largest living bird. Flightless but fast runner. Two-toed feet.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

rhea.name: Rhea
rhea.description: Large flightless bird. South American species. Fast runner.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

dromaius_novaehollandiae.name: Dromaius novaehollandiae
dromaius_novaehollandiae.description: Second largest bird. Flightless and fast runner. Australian native.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

apteryx.name: Apteryx
apteryx.description: Small flightless bird. Long beak with nostrils at tip. Nocturnal.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

casuarius.name: Casuarius
casuarius.description: Large aggressive bird. Flightless rainforest species. Helmet-like casque present.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

neophron.name: Neophron
neophron.description: Neophron is a medium-sized scavenging bird. It feeds mainly on carrion. One of the smallest vultures.
introduction: Neophron inhabits open country and rocky regions.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs
Nervous system: Well developed brain and spinal cord

passer.name: Passer
passer.description: Passer is a small seed-eating bird. Lives close to human habitation. Very social in nature.
introduction: Passer inhabits towns, villages, and farmlands.
It feeds on grains and insects.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

gallus_gallus.name: Gallus gallus
gallus_gallus.description: Gallus gallus is the wild ancestor of domestic fowl. Ground-dwelling bird. Strong and alert.
introduction: Gallus gallus lives in forests and scrublands.
Feeds on grains, seeds, and insects.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

trochilus_colubris.name: Trochilus colubris
trochilus_colubris.description: Trochilus colubris is a very small bird. Capable of hovering flight. Feeds mainly on nectar.
introduction: Trochilus colubris lives in gardens and forests.
It feeds on flower nectar and insects.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

chalcophaps_indica.name: Chalcophaps indica
chalcophaps_indica.description: Chalcophaps indica is a small forest pigeon. Known for green shiny wings. Ground-feeding bird.
introduction: Feeds on fallen fruits and seeds.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

pitohui_dichrous.name: Pitohui dichrous
pitohui_dichrous.description: Pitohui dichrous is a poisonous bird. Skin and feathers contain toxins. Bright warning coloration present.
introduction: Pitohui dichrous inhabits forests of New Guinea.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

geospiza_magnirostris.name: Geospiza magnirostris
geospiza_magnirostris.description: Geospiza magnirostris has a very large beak. It feeds mainly on hard seeds. A classic example of adaptive radiation.
introduction: Shows strong natural selection on beak size.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

geospiza_fortis.name: Geospiza fortis
geospiza_fortis.description: Geospiza fortis has a medium-sized beak. Feeds on seeds of moderate hardness. Highly variable species.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

geospiza_fuliginosa.name: Geospiza fuliginosa
geospiza_fuliginosa.description: Geospiza fuliginosa is the smallest ground finch. Has a fine pointed beak. Feeds on small seeds.
introduction: Shows specialization for small food items.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

geospiza_difficilis.name: Geospiza difficilis
geospiza_difficilis.description: Geospiza difficilis has a sharp beak. Feeds on insects and seeds. Some populations show unusual feeding habits.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

geospiza_scandens.name: Geospiza scandens
geospiza_scandens.description: Geospiza scandens is adapted to cactus feeding. Beak is long and pointed. Feeds on cactus flowers and fruits.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

camarhynchus_psittacula.name: Camarhynchus psittacula
camarhynchus_psittacula.description: Camarhynchus psittacula has a parrot-like beak. Feeds on insects and fruits. Tree-dwelling finch.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

camarhynchus_parvulus.name: Camarhynchus parvulus
camarhynchus_parvulus.description: Camarhynchus parvulus is a small arboreal finch. Feeds mainly on insects. Active and agile.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

camarhynchus_pallidus.name: Camarhynchus pallidus
camarhynchus_pallidus.description: Camarhynchus pallidus uses tools. Feeds on insects in bark. One of the smartest finches.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

certhidea_olivacea.name: Certhidea olivacea
certhidea_olivacea.description: Certhidea olivacea is a small slender finch. Feeds mainly on insects. Warbler-like behaviour.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

platyspiza_crassirostris.name: Platyspiza crassirostris
platyspiza_crassirostris.description: Platyspiza crassirostris has a strong beak. Feeds mainly on leaves and buds. Largest tree finch.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)
Respiratory type: Lungs with air sacs

archaeopteryx.name: Archaeopteryx
archaeopteryx.description: Archaeopteryx is a fossil bird. Shows reptilian and avian traits. Important evolutionary link.
introduction: Could glide but not true flight.
features: Level of Organisation: Organ system level
Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Deuterostomous)

ornithorhynchus_anatinus.name: Ornithorhynchus anatinus
ornithorhynchus_anatinus.description: Ornithorhynchus anatinus is an egg-laying mammal. It is semi-aquatic and carnivorous. Shows reptilian and mammalian features together.
introduction: It lives in freshwater rivers and streams of Australia.
It swims well and feeds on aquatic invertebrates.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

echidna.name: Echidna
echidna.description: Echidna is an egg-laying mammal. Body covered with spines. Feeds mainly on ants and termites.
introduction: It is found in Australia and New Guinea.
Lives in forests, grasslands, and deserts.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)

antechinus_flavipes.name: Antechinus flavipes
antechinus_flavipes.description: Small carnivorous marsupial. Highly active and insect-eating. Native to Australia.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

macropus.name: Macropus
macropus.description: Large herbivorous marsupial. Powerful hind limbs for jumping. Symbol of Australia.
introduction: Lives in grasslands and open forests.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

phascolarctos_cinereus.name: Phascolarctos cinereus
phascolarctos_cinereus.description: Tree-dwelling herbivorous marsupial. Feeds only on eucalyptus leaves. Slow-moving animal.
introduction: Lives in eucalyptus forests of Australia.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

vombatus.name: Vombatus
vombatus.description: Burrowing herbivorous marsupial. Short legs and strong claws. Ground-dwelling animal.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

perameles.name: Perameles
perameles.description: Small ground-dwelling marsupial. Fast-moving omnivore. Strong digging ability.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

petaurus_breviceps.name: Petaurus breviceps
petaurus_breviceps.description: Small arboreal marsupial. Glides between trees. Nocturnal and social.
introduction: Lives in forests of Australia and New Guinea.
Feeds on nectar, fruits, and insects.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

notoryctes.name: Notoryctes
notoryctes.description: Blind burrowing marsupial. Lives underground in deserts. Highly specialized animal.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

didelphis_marsupialis.name: Didelphis marsupialis
didelphis_marsupialis.description: Omnivorous American marsupial. Highly adaptable animal. Good climber and scavenger.
introduction: Lives in forests and urban areas.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

myrmecobius_fasciatus.name: Myrmecobius fasciatus
myrmecobius_fasciatus.description: Small diurnal marsupial. Feeds mainly on termites. Striped body.
introduction: Found in open woodlands of Australia.
Lives in burrows and hollow logs.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

thylacinus_cynocephalus.name: Thylacinus cynocephalus
thylacinus_cynocephalus.description: Largest carnivorous marsupial (extinct). Dog-like body with stripes. Once top predator.
introduction: Formerly lived in Australia and Tasmania.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

spilocuscus_maculatus.name: Spilocuscus maculatus
spilocuscus_maculatus.description: Arboreal fruit-eating marsupial. Slow-moving tree dweller. Spotted fur.
introduction: Found in rainforests of New Guinea and Australia.

Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord

dasyurus_maculatus.name: Dasyurus maculatus
dasyurus_maculatus.description: Carnivorous marsupial predator. Nocturnal hunter. Strong climber.
introduction: Lives in forests and rocky areas.
Feeds on birds, mammals, and insects.
features: Body plan: Tube within a tube body plan (Protostomous)
Nervous system: Well-developed brain and spinal cord
